section.title: Export and Version
section.para: Knowledge users with Content Manager or Administrator role can create versions or export content and access this functionality from the Task Pane, see ; Editors can export content only and access this functionality from the Short Cuts menu. The primary purpose of creating versions is to make releases and content available to internal and external customers in release file format.

figure.title: Export and Version – Administrators and Content Managers

section.title: Export
section.para: Knowledge currently supports the generation of a SNOMED CT Release File Format 2 (RF2) release. Select the Export button, provide the information needed and select the Create Export button.
When an export is initiated, several steps happen in the background before a file is packaged for download. Once it is ready, your browser will prompt you to download the file to your computer.

The create an export form contains the following fields:
Select modules - Select the modules that you want to export from. The module that you have edits in is selected by default.
Content range - Select the date range for the content you are exporting. Note that when the files are exported, the content's date stamp will be updated to the selected start date.
Generate SCTID for content with missing IDs - Select this option when SCTIDs should be added to any newly created SNOMED CT concepts that do not have SCTIDs. Include the namespace identifier provided by SNOMED international when this option is selected.
Export type - SNOMED CT RF2 is selected by default. The Solor RF2 compatible release will be available in a future Knowledge release.

mediaobject.alt: Create an Export modal displays a form with the following information: select modules, content range, generate SCTIDs, namespace, export type, and buttons Create and Cancel.

section.title: Create a Version
section.para:
When content is ready to be released a Content Manager or Administrator can create a version by selecting the Create a Version button. A form will appear asking for the following information:
Module location - This is where the new version module will be located in the taxonomy after creation.
Version name – the user specified name of the version module.
Content version date - This optional field will update the content modification dates of the concepts to the date selected. If it is left blank, no changes will be made to the original dates on each concept.
Content range – Select the date range for the content you want to create a version for. To better assist you, you can optionally select the "Select by version date" link to pick a date based on a previous version.
Run Classifier – Gives the user the option to run the classifier as part generating a version.
Perform QA Test - QA tests are necessary to ensure accurate data. The version may not be created if there is a QA error. You can perform the test independently before creating a version or run it in this process. If you run QA in this form and there are errors, the version will not be created and you will be taken to the QA results page.
Generate SCTIDs for content with missing IDs - If there are any SNOMED content with missing SCTIDs, the system can generate them for you. Include the namespace identifier provided by SNOMED international when this option is selected.
Namespace - If you choose to generate SCTIDs, this is the SNOMED identifier that is provided to you by SNOMED CT.
Create and download and export file - Downloads a compressed file of all of the contents.
Save a copy to the repository - Publishes the exported file into the repository server
This is configurable for each customer and is not configured in the Knowledge demonstration enviornment..
Export Type – SNOMED CT RF2 is supported at this time.
The Solor RF2 comptabible export will be supported in a future Knowledge release.
Select "Create Version" to begin the backend versioning process.
